features.name: HTTP client foundation
features.description: reqwest-based client with API key auth, proper headers (anthropic-version, x-api-key), error types using thiserror
notes: Implemented with reqwest, full error taxonomy, retry-after header parsing

features.name: Request/response types
features.description: Complete serde models for MessagesRequest, MessagesResponse, Message, Content, Tool, ToolUse, ToolResult. Match official API exactly.
notes: All types implemented with serde, includes prompt caching support, Model registry with 9 models

features.name: Non-streaming messages
features.description: Implement send_message() for synchronous completion. Parse JSON response, handle errors, return typed MessagesResponse.
notes: Working send_message(), tested with simple_chat example

features.name: SSE streaming parser
features.description: Parse Server-Sent Events stream using eventsource-stream or custom parser. Handle all event types: message_start, content_block_start, content_block_delta, content_block_stop, message_delta, message_stop.
notes: Implemented with eventsource-stream, handles all event types, proper error handling

features.name: Streaming messages API
features.description: Implement send_streaming() returning impl Stream<Item = Result<StreamEvent>>. Use tokio streams for async iteration.
notes: Working send_streaming() with Pin<Box<dyn Stream>>, tested with streaming_chat example

features.name: Tool use primitives
features.description: Types for Tool definition, ToolUse in responses, ToolResult in requests. Support disable_user_input field for programmatic calling.

features.name: Multi-turn conversation builder
features.description: Builder pattern for conversation history management. Handle role alternation (user/assistant), tool use/results, proper message formatting.

features.name: Token counting
features.description: Estimate token counts using tiktoken-rs or similar. Needed for context window management (200K tokens for Claude 3.5 Sonnet).

features.name: Error handling taxonomy
features.description: Comprehensive error types: APIError (4xx/5xx), NetworkError, ParseError, RateLimitError (with retry-after). Use thiserror for library errors.

features.name: Retry logic with backoff
features.description: Implement exponential backoff for rate limits (429) and server errors (5xx). Respect retry-after headers. Use tokio::time::sleep.

features.name: Examples and integration tests
features.description: Example binaries: simple chat, streaming chat, tool use, multi-turn conversation. Integration tests against real API (gated by env var).

features.name: Documentation and publishing
features.description: README with quickstart, API docs with examples, publish to crates.io as 'claude-sdk' or 'anthropic-sdk-rust'.

features.name: Prompt caching support
features.description: Support API prompt caching via cache_control blocks. Reduces costs by caching system prompts, tool definitions, and long context. Add CacheControl type, support in Message content.
notes: API feature - cache_control blocks mark cacheable content
Supports ephemeral (5 min TTL) caching
Saves tokens/cost on repeated context (system prompt, tools)
Just need to add cache_control field to content blocks

features.name: Amazon Bedrock support
features.description: Support Claude models via AWS Bedrock. Implement AWS SigV4 signing, bedrock-runtime endpoint, handle different request/response envelope format.
notes: Bedrock uses AWS SigV4 authentication instead of API keys
Endpoint: bedrock-runtime.{region}.amazonaws.com
Request/response wrapped in Bedrock envelope
Use aws-config and aws-sigv4 crates

features.name: Interactive REPL
features.description: Build interactive REPL binary for testing and debugging. Features: multi-turn chat, tool execution preview, streaming display, conversation save/load, token counting display.
notes: Separate binary: src/bin/claude-repl.rs
Use rustyline for readline functionality
Display streaming responses in real-time
Show token usage and costs
Save conversations to JSON
Test tool calls interactively
Useful for SDK demos and debugging

features.name: Documentation and publishing
features.description: README with quickstart, API docs with examples, publish to crates.io as 'claude-sdk' or 'anthropic-sdk-rust'.

features.name: CI/CD Pipeline
features.description: GitHub Actions workflows for testing, building, and publishing. Includes: cargo test, cargo clippy, cargo fmt check, automated crates.io publishing on release tags.
notes: Workflow 1: PR checks (test, clippy, fmt) - .github/workflows/ci.yml
Workflow 2: Release automation (publish to crates.io) - .github/workflows/release.yml
Workflow 3: Upstream SDK monitoring (weekly check for new models) - .github/workflows/upstream-check.yml
RELEASE.md documents complete release process with version bumping
